title: Browns trade up, pick QB Sanders in 5th round
content: The Browns traded up in the fifth round Saturday and selected quarterback Shedeur Sanders at No. 144 overall, ending the Colorado star's NFL draft free fall.

title: Steelers, waiting on Rodgers, draft QB Howard
content: The Steelers selected Ohio State's Will Howard with the No. 185th pick in the sixth round Saturday, adding a quarterback to their depth chart while they continue to wait on an answer from Aaron Rodgers.

title: Eagles pick QB McCord, FBS passing leader in '24
content: The Super Bowl champion Philadelphia Eagles added to their quarterback room Saturday, picking Syracuse's Kyle McCord with the No. 181st pick in the sixth round.

title: LT declines Carter's ask for 56: Make own mark
content: Lawrence Taylor wants newly drafted Giants pass rusher Abdul Carter to create his own legacy, one that won't include wearing the No. 56 that Taylor made famous during his legendary career.

title: Cavaliers go up 3-0, hand Heat worst playoff loss
content: In rolling to a convincing 3-0 lead in this Eastern Conference first-round series, the No. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers handed Bam Adebayo and the Miami Heat their worst-ever playoff loss.

title: Seahawks open QB space, trade Howell to Vikes
content: The Seahawks have traded quarterback Sam Howell to the Vikings, where he becomes the likely backup to J.J. McCarthy.

title: Wrexham clinches historic 3rd-straight promotion
content: Wrexham sealed a historic promotion to the EFL Championship with a 3-0 win against Charlton Athletic in front of Hollywood owners Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney at the Stok Cae Ras.

title: Michigan lands No. 4 pocket passer Smigiel
content: Four-star quarterback Brady Smigiel, ESPN's No. 4 pocket passer in the 2026 class, has committed to Michigan.

title: 'There's no drop-off down there': How the bottom of the order is powering the Cubs' offense to top of MLB
content: Chicago has scored more runs than any team in the majors so far -- with the help of some unexpected sluggers.

title: Slow start? Not this year! Francisco Lindor has Mets rolling
content: After stumbling out of the gate last season, the star shortstop and his team are lighting up Citi Field.

title: Luka, LeBron and the most dangerous 60-foot passes in the game
content: These mega-outlets illustrate a growing Lakers connection that should strike fear across the NBA. And they're only going to happen more.

title: Mbappé starts on Madrid bench for Copa final
content: Kylian Mbappé will start on the bench for Real Madrid's Copa del Rey final clash with Barcelona on Saturday, after failing to fully recover from an ankle injury.

title: Sarr and Eze send Crystal Palace to FA Cup final
content: Crystal Palace outplayed Aston Villa to reach the FA Cup final with two brilliant goals by Ismaila Sarr and another by Eberechi Eze sealing a 3-0 win.

title: Kane suspended for Bayern's title-winning game
content: Harry Kane will miss Bayern Munich's Bundesliga match against RB Leipzig next Saturday due to suspension.

title: Messi, Suarez miss training ahead of Dallas clash
content: Mascherano confirmed changes will be made to the starting line up for the match against Dallas on Sunday afternoon due to the 72-hour turnaround after the Concacaf Champions Cup first leg semifinal game versus Vancouver

title: Bompastor, Bright talk up comeback against Barça
content: Sonia Bompastor has urged Chelsea to "go for it" against Barcelona in the second leg of the Champions League semifinal on Sunday.

title: Senator wants travel policies eased before '26 WC
content: Sen. Ron Wyden of Oregon has asked top Trump administration officials to reconsider policies that are impacting travelers arriving in the United States, citing upcoming sporting events like the 2026 World Cup.

title: More than just the 'Burrito Boys': How a Bay Area taqueria built an amateur soccer team with Open Cup lore
content: El Farolito made the third round of the U.S. Open Cup for a second straight year and routinely beats professional teams. What's its secret?

title: Stanley Cup playoffs odds: Hurricanes the Eastern fave, Jets best odds in the West
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP

title: The biggest question facing every WNBA team when training camp opens Sunday
content: Who will carry Phoenix into its new era? What will Reese and Cardoso do in Year 2? Are the Fever title contenders?

title: NWSL MVP Tracker: Thompson leads USWNT in ranking, but other internationals dominate
content: The NWSL MVP Tracker is back for 2025 to rank the best players, as Alyssa Thompson tries to catch Debinha and Temwa Chawinga.

title: 2025 NFL draft: Fantasy football analysis of Rounds 1-3
content: Liz Loza, Matt Bowen and Mike Clay break down the fantasy potential of early-round rookies from the NFL draft and provide initial 2025 projections.

title: Should you draft Caitlin Clark or A'ja Wilson at No. 1?
content: A'ja Wilson opened as the top ranked player in fantasy women's basketball entering the 2025 season, but does someone else have a case to supplant Wilson in 2025?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Bayern eye Chelsea's Nkunku
content: Arsenal and Bayern Munich are reportedly ready to compete to sign Chelsea's Christopher Nkunku in the summer. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: J&K villagers in border areas prepare 'Modi bunkers' as tensions rise along LoC
content: Following the recent terror attack in Pahalgam, residents in the remote border villages of Poonch, Jammu and Kashmir, are preparing their underground bunkers, locally known as "Modi bunkers." These bunkers, built during Prime Minister Modi's tenure to protect civilians from cross-border shelling, are being restocked with essentials.

title: India’s sudden Jhelum water release sparks panic in PoK
content: A sudden surge in the Jhelum river, allegedly due to India's unnotified water release from the Uri Dam, has triggered chaos in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. This abrupt discharge led to a water emergency in Hattian Bala, forcing residents to evacuate. Pakistani authorities have condemned the action as a violation of the Indus Waters Treaty, escalating tensions between the two nations.

title: Judge 'not competent' to write verdict, Allahabad HC sends him for training
content: Allahabad High Court has expressed serious concerns regarding Additional District Judge Amit Verma's inability to write judgments. The court directed that Verma, from Kanpur Nagar, undergo three months of training at the Judicial Training and Research Institute in Lucknow. This decision came after the judge dismissed an amendment application with a brief, unsubstantiated order.

title: Pahalgam fallout: 1,024 Bangladesh illegals arrested in Gujarat
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, Gujarat police launched a large-scale operation targeting illegal Bangladeshi residents, resulting in the arrest of 890 individuals in Ahmedabad and 134 in Surat. Four detainees are suspected of criminal links, including potential al-Qaida connections. Authorities are expediting deportation procedures and investigating the source of fraudulent documents used by the detainees.

title: Playing neutral or free hand to India?: Teasing out Trump's post-Pahalgam comment
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, President Trump's remarks on India-Pakistan relations have sparked debate. His statement that they'll "figure it out" has been interpreted as either neutrality or tacit approval for India to act. While some see it as acknowledging historical religious tensions, others, like analyst Christine Fair, view it as a signal for India to address Pakistan's actions.

title: Elon Musk replies to JD Vance's family photos from Taj Mahal: One of the ...
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, recently visited the Taj Mahal during a four-day trip to India. Vance shared photos on X, with Elon Musk commenting on the monument's beauty. The family's visit included a warm welcome from Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister and stringent security measures along their route.

title: Mansarovar yatra to resume in June after five-year hiatus
content: India has announced the resumption of the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra in June 2025, after it was suspended in 2020 due to Covid-19. The pilgrimage will accommodate 750 pilgrims through Lipulekh Pass in Uttarakhand and Nathu La Pass in Sikkim. This move is part of broader efforts to rebuild ties with China, including discussions on trans-border river cooperation and people-centric services.

title: Patriotism must be 'param dharma' to defeat terrorism: Piyush Goyal
content: Union minister Piyush Goyal asserted that incidents like the Pahalgam terror attack will persist unless all Indians prioritise patriotism and nationalism. He affirmed India's capability to respond strongly, emphasising that such acts won't deter the nation's spirit. Goyal expressed confidence in the swift resumption of Kashmir tourism and the continuation of the Amarnath Yatra, highlighting India's resolve to eliminate terrorism.

title: Tesla CEO Musk is not 'happy', says 'We should have been...'
content: Elon Musk expressed his disappointment that humans haven't reached Mars yet, despite SpaceX's efforts. He referenced the rapid progress from the first flight to the moon landing, highlighting the current delay in space exploration.

title: Met Police probe Pak diplomat's throat-slitting gesture at Indian-origin protesters in UK
content: The Metropolitan Police are investigating a throat-slitting gesture by a Pakistani diplomat towards Indian protesters in London, who were demonstrating against a terror attack. The Pakistani high commission organized a counter-protest, escalating tensions with loud music and provocative signs. Amidst the chaos, arrests were made, and Indian protesters felt unfairly targeted by the police, alleging biased treatment.

title: Omar’s ministers criss-cross states for safety of Kashmiris facing Pahalgam ‘backlash’
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, the J&K government has deployed ministers to various states to address reports of threats and attacks against Kashmiris. These ministers are meeting with chief ministers and other officials to coordinate assistance and ensure the safety of Kashmiri students and business communities.

title: ‘I’m doing the work’: Melinda Gates responds to Musk, Bezos' ex-wife criticism
content: Melinda Gates addressed criticisms from tech leaders like Elon Musk and MacKenzie Scott regarding her philanthropic endeavors, emphasizing her commitment to impactful work through the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation and Pivotal Ventures.

title: Safety first: Govt mulls mandatory ABS for all two-wheelers above 50cc
content: The government is considering mandating anti-lock braking systems (ABS) for all two-wheelers exceeding 50cc to enhance safety and reduce accidents. Experts emphasize ABS and helmet use to protect vulnerable riders, who constitute a significant portion of road fatalities. Road safety experts also highlight the need for better transport planning and dedicated lanes to improve two-wheeler safety.

title: PBKS vs KKR becomes first IPL 2025 game to be called off
content: The IPL 2025 match between Punjab Kings and Kolkata Knight Riders ended in a no-result due to heavy rain. PBKS posted a competitive 201/4, powered by Prabhsimran Singh's explosive 83 and Priyansh Arya's rapid 69. KKR's bowlers, Vaibhav Arora and Andre Russell, managed to restrict PBKS in the final overs.

title: 175 detained in anti-terror operations following Pahalgam terror attack
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, police in Anantnag district, South Kashmir, have detained 175 suspects. Extensive search-and-cordon operations are underway with the collaboration of the Army and CRPF. Numerous raids were conducted, and security has been heightened across the district with additional checkpoints and intensified patrolling. J&K police also conducted searches at residences of terrorist associates in Srinagar.

title: Pakistan ready for neutral probe into Pahalgam attack: Sharif
content: Amidst escalating tensions following the Pahalgam attack, Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif has offered to join a neutral investigation, while also condemning India's accusations as baseless. Sharif asserted Pakistan's military readiness, warning against any misadventures, and cautioned India against blocking Pakistan's water share, threatening a strong response. The situation remains critical, with concerns of broader conflict looming large.

title: Ladakh council meets Amit Shah, wants India embassies update sites on UT
content: A BJP delegation, headed by LAHDC chief Tashi Gyalson, engaged with Union Home Minister Amit Shah in Delhi, advocating for improvements in gazetted recruitment and updating Indian embassy websites to acknowledge Ladakh's UT status. They emphasized the importance of new districts for inclusive development and sought Shah's intervention to safeguard local youth's rights and restore budget allocations.

title: 'Maybe Putin doesn't want to stop war,' says Trump after meeting Zelenskyy
content: Donald Trump criticised Vladimir Putin for attacks on Ukrainian civilian areas, suggesting a change in approach through sanctions. This came after Trump's meeting with Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Rome, their first in-person encounter since February. Putin, meanwhile, expressed willingness for talks with Ukraine without preconditions during a meeting with a US envoy.

title: Pakistan violates ceasefire along LoC, Indian Army retaliates
content: Pakistan violated the ceasefire along the Line of Control in Kashmir for the second consecutive night, prompting retaliation from the Indian Army. This follows the Pahalgam attack, where 26 civilians were killed by The Resistance Front, linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba.

title: New Record! Prabhsimran becomes first uncapped Punjab batter to ...
content: Prabhsimran Singh made history for Punjab Kings, becoming the first uncapped batter to surpass 1000 IPL runs. His explosive 83 against KKR, alongside Priyansh Arya's 69, propelled PBKS to a formidable 201/4. Prabhsimran's milestone and Arya's impressive debut season solidify Punjab's top order as they pursue their first IPL title.

title: 8 killed, over 750 injured after massive explosion in southern Iran's port
content: A massive explosion at Rajaei port in Bandar Abbas, Iran, injured  over 750 people, sending a plume of smoke into the sky. The blast's cause remains unconfirmed, but it occurred at a port handling container shipments, oil tanks, and petrochemical facilities. The incident happened amidst ongoing nuclear negotiations between Iran and the United States in Oman.

title: Pakistan moves to secure medicines after India trade halt
content: Pakistani health authorities are taking emergency measures to secure pharmaceutical supplies after trade ties with India were suspended. DRAP is exploring alternative sources in China, Russia, and Europe for raw materials and essential medicines. The PPMA has urged the government to exempt the pharmaceutical sector from the trade ban to avoid shortages of life-saving drugs.

title: IPL 2025 Points Table: Latest standings after KKR vs PBKS match
content: The Kolkata Knight Riders and Punjab Kings match in the Indian Premier League 2025 got called off. Rain played spoilsport at Eden Gardens. Punjab Kings scored 201 for 4, with Arya and Prabhsimran hitting half-centuries. KKR's chase was cut short. Both teams shared a point. Punjab Kings are now fourth in the standings. Kolkata Knight Riders are seventh.

title: 'Chhedoge toh chhodenge nahin': UP CM's warning after Pahalgam attack
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has strongly condemned the violence, assuring a firm response. He emphasized India's zero-tolerance policy towards terrorism, stating the nation is prepared to retaliate appropriately. Yogi expressed condolences to the victims' families, including Shubham Dwivedi's family from Kanpur, asserting that such acts are unacceptable and signal terrorism's decline.

title: How Krunal Pandya & Suyash Sharma are powering RCB's dream run
content: Delhi Capitals boast a strong spin attack with Kuldeep Yadav, Axar Patel and Vipraj Nigam, while RCB rely on Krunal Pandya and Suyash Sharma. RCB's spin coach praised Krunal's evolved action and Suyash's ability to turn the ball and deceive batters. Both teams are vying for the top spot in the points table, making their upcoming clash crucial.

title: Arjun Tendulkar labelled 'tomorrow's legend' after Yograj's 'Gayle' remark
content: Arjun Tendulkar is generating buzz, fueled by Yograj Singh's prediction of him becoming the "next Chris Gayle" if he prioritizes batting. Recent footage shows Arjun training with Zaheer Khan, further igniting excitement about his potential. With Mumbai Indians preparing for a crucial IPL match, Arjun might seize opportunities to prove himself as a rising star.

title: Russia ready for Ukraine talks without preconditions, says Putin
content: Amidst ongoing conflict, President Putin has expressed Russia's readiness for peace talks with Ukraine without preconditions, following remarks from Donald Trump. Simultaneously, Russia claims complete control over parts of the Kursk region, a statement Ukraine disputes, asserting continued defensive operations. Trump and Zelenskyy met at the Vatican, discussing potential ceasefire terms and expressing mutual interest in swift action towards peace.

title: Single? Dating? Gill sets the record straight on his relationship status
content: Shubman Gill, the Indian and Gujarat Titans batter, has dismissed rumours about his relationships, labeling them as "ridiculous." In an interview, the 25-year-old clarified he's been single for over three years, attributing the gossip to his demanding cricketing schedule. Gill emphasised his focus on his career, stating that his time on the road leaves little room for relationships.

title: India lifted 171m people from extreme poverty in 11 years: World Bank
content: The World Bank reports India lifted 171 million people out of extreme poverty between 2011-12 and 2022-23, reducing it to 2.3%. Using a $3.65/day poverty line, 378 million were lifted out of poverty. While significant progress occurred, challenges remain, including youth unemployment and gender disparities in employment, despite rising employment rates.

title: 2025 Royal Enfield Hunter 350 launched in India at Rs 1.5L: What's new
content: The bike gets LED headlamps, a tripper pod and a type-C USB charger. The 2025 Hunter 350 continues to be powered by a 349cc air-cooled J-series engine, producing 20.2hp of power and 27Nm of torque. It comes paired with a 5-speed gearbox, now enhanced with a slip-assist clutch.

title: 'Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma moved to London because ...'
content: Dr. Sriram Nene revealed Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma's move to London. The couple sought to escape constant media attention in India. They desired a more private life for their family. Despite the move, Virat Kohli continues his cricket career. He recently achieved a record in the IPL. He scored his 26th half-century at M Chinnaswamy Stadium.

title: 'If you leave now ... ': J&K CM's message for tourists after Pahalgam attack
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26, Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah has urged tourists to remain in the region, emphasizing that their departure would fulfill the attackers' goals. He acknowledged tourists' fears but assured them of support and instructed officials to assist those wishing to relocate.

title: Shastri issues warning for Vaibhav Suryavanshi: 'There will be failures'
content: Ravi Shastri has lauded the emergence of promising young batsmen in the IPL. He specifically mentioned Ayush Mhatre, Vaibhav Suryavanshi, Priyansh Arya, and Prabhsimran Singh. Shastri highlighted their fearless approach and potential for international cricket. He advised caution regarding Suryavanshi, anticipating increased challenges for the young player. Shastri urged selectors to capitalise on current form when choosing players.

title: After 5 years, Kailash Mansarovar Yatra to resume in June this year
content: After a five-year hiatus due to the pandemic and border tensions, India and China will resume the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra in June 2025. The pilgrimage, significant for Hindus, Jains, and Buddhists, will proceed through Lipulekh Pass in Uttarakhand and Nathu La in Sikkim. This resumption signals a positive step towards mending bilateral relations following recent diplomatic discussions and troop withdrawals.

title: Pakistan army chief does it again, says 'Muslims distinct from Hindus'
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, Pakistan's army chief, General Asim Munir, has reignited the two-nation theory, asserting the distinct nature of Muslims from Hindus across all facets of life. Munir emphasized Pakistan's resolve to defend itself, referencing actions taken by the Indian government after the attack. He also reiterated Pakistan's stance on Kashmir, referring to it as Pakistan's "jugular vein."

title: 'Tu mere jaisa nahin khel sakta ...': Rohit Sharma to young LSG batter
content: Rohit Sharma, known for his mentorship, shared invaluable batting advice with LSG's Abdul Samad, emphasising personalised technique and adaptability to varying conditions. He highlighted the importance of mindset and leveraging individual talent, rather than imitation. This guidance comes ahead of a crucial IPL clash between Mumbai Indians and Lucknow Super Giants, both vying for playoff contention.

title: 'Felt trapped & isolated': Rahul Gandhi on why he led Bharat Jodo Yatra
content: Rahul Gandhi stated that the Bharat Jodo Yatra was initiated due to the Congress party feeling politically stifled, citing compromised media access and an oppressive political environment. He emphasized the need for a new kind of politician to address challenges like concentrated capital and modern media. Gandhi also highlighted the importance of education, healthcare, and democratic space.

title: "We Never Harm Our Neighbours, But...": Mohan Bhagwat After J&K Attack
content: In a veiled message after the Pahalgam terror attacks in which 26 people were killed, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat has said non-violence is India's religion and a key part of its values but so is teaching a lesson to "oppressors and hooligans".

title: Another Terrorist's House Bombed In Crackdown After Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: An intense raid by authorities, aiming to dismantle terrorist infrastructure, has bombed the house of another suspected terrorist in Jammu and Kashmir, continuing its massive crackdown on terrorists days after the Pahalgam attack that killed 26.

title: 8 Killed, 750 Injured In Massive Explosion At Iran's Most Advanced Port
content: At least eight people were killed and 750 injured after several containers exploded at a key Iranian port on Saturday, causing a massive fire. Videos showed thick smoke billowing from the port area.

title: Palestinian President Names Likely Successor In Bid To Reassure World Powers
content: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas named close confidant Hussein al-Sheikh as his deputy and likely successor on Saturday.

title: ISRO Successfully Conducts Short Duration Hot Test Of Semicryogenic Engine
content: A short duration hot test of the semicryogenic engine was successfully conducted at the test facility in ISRO Propulsion Complex (IPRC) at Mahendragiri in Tamil Nadu, the space agency said on Saturday.

title: Student, Retired Teachers, Lawyer Among 19 Arrested For Remarks On J&K Attack
content: At least 19 people have been arrested in three states in the northeast over remarks on the terror attack in Pahalgam, which claimed 26 lives, including those of a Navy officer and an officer from the Intelligence Bureau.

title: 'Fearing Future Without Babies', Students 'Race' Sperm In Los Angeles
content: A commentator yells excitedly as hundreds of spectators stand glued to a video of a racecourse -- but the athletes they are rooting for are actually tiny sperm cells.

title: "I Kill You": Student, 21, Held For Sending Threat Mails To Gautam Gambhir
content: The Delhi Police has arrested a 21-year-old engineering student with alleged mental health issues for sending threat mails to the head coach of men's cricket team and former BJP MP Gautam Gambhir, an official said on Saturday.

title: "He Has To Be Dealt With Differently": Trump Warns Putin Over Ukraine
content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday criticised Russian President Vladimir Putin for attacks on civilian areas of Ukraine in recent days, and said, "Maybe he doesn't want to stop the war."

title: Pakistan Scrambles To Secure Drug Supplies After India Trade Halt: Report
content: Pakistani health authorities have initiated "emergency preparedness" measures to secure pharmaceutical supplies in response to the suspension of trade ties with India, according to a media report on Saturday.

title: Pope Francis Buried Inside His Favourite Rome Church
content: Pope Francis was buried inside his favourite Rome church after a funeral mass in St Peter's Square, the Vatican said on Saturday.

title: Bodies of Man, 23, Minor Girl Found Hanging From Tree In Odisha: Cops
content: Odisha Police on Saturday recovered the bodies of a man and a girl hanging from a tree in Kalahandi district.

title: Former Journalist Who Survived Nazi Concentration Camp Dies At 102
content: Jacques Moalic, a former Agence France-Presse journalist who survived deportation to the Buchenwald concentration camp in World War II, has died aged 102, his family said.

title: Putin Says Russia Ready To Resume Talks With Ukraine "Without Preconditions"
content: "During yesterday's talks with Trump's envoy Witkoff, Vladimir Putin reiterated that Russia is ready to resume negotiations with Ukraine without any preconditions," said Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov.

title: "Till 140 Crore Indians Don't Consider Patriotism...": Minister Piyush Goyal On J&K Attack
content: Union minister Piyush Goyal has said that terror attacks like the one in Pahalgam would continue to disturb the nation as long as all 140 crore Indians don't regard patriotism and nationalism as their "paramount dharma".

title: Concerned About "Hobnobbing" Between Bangladesh, Pak: Assam Chief Minister
content: Bangladesh's turn towards Islamic extremism, its "hobnobbing" with Pakistan and ISIS flags at protest rallies in the country have sparked concern among Indian authorities and members of Sheikh Hasina's Awami League.

title: Pak Woman With Expired Visa Found Living In Odisha, Asked To Leave
content: A Pakistani woman, living in India since 2008, has been asked to leave the country as her visa was found to have expired last year, said the police.

title: K Kavitha Flags Off Car Rally Ahead Of BRS' Silver Jubilee Celebrations
content: In a spirited lead-up to the Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) Silver Jubilee celebrations, BRS MLC Kalvakuntla Kavitha on Saturday flagged off 25 cars from her residence in Hyderabad.

title: Updates: Pope Francis Buried Inside His Favourite Rome Church
content: Pope Francis died at the age of 88 on April 21 due to a stroke, weeks after he returned home after battling double pneumonia.

title: Opinion: Opinion | When Terror Struck Paradise: What Comes After Pahalgam
content: Any analysis of the heinous terrorist attack at Pahalgam must begin with an outright condemnation and a deep expression of regret for the loss of innocent lives in the most brutal manner.

title: Eastern Conference playoffs: Magic, Bucks win Game 3s to get on the board
content: the 2025 NBA playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the Finals . the no. 2 Boston Celtics lost Game 3 against the No. 7 seed Orlando Magic with Franz Wagner and Paolo Banchero combing .

title: Chris Eubank Jr. vs Conor Benn LIVE boxing updates
content: Chis Eubank Jr. and Conor Benn face-off after the final press conference before their fight. (3:06) Follow live updates from 9 p.m. BST as Chris Eubank Jr. faces Conor Benn on Saturday night at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium in North London. In Thursday's press conference Eubank Jr. spoke of his  "pain" to cut his weight , and in Friday's weigh-in he was  fined $500,000  for missing the 160 pound weight limit. Find out all the information on the  Eubank-Benn rivalry .

title: Expert's picks, best bets: Can Machado Garry elude Prates' hard strikes?
content: welterweight contenders Ian Machado Garry and Carlos Prates will clash to determine who moves closer to a title shot at UFC Fight Night on sunday . the fight follows the first loss of his career against Shavkat Rakhmonov in December .

title: Western Conference playoffs: Wolves rout Lakers, take 2-1 lead
content: the 2024-25 NBA playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . on friday, the no. 1 seed Oklahoma City Thunder completed a historic comeback to go up 3-0 in the series against the No. 8 seed Memphis Grizzlies .

title: Transfer portal's lure involves more than just a big payday for players
content: Clayton Powell-Lee has spent the past month searching for an answer . he can build on his 53 tackles last season, after which he landed a six-figure name, image and likeness contract with the school . the market for defensive backs is booming, his agents say .

title: Follow live: Thunder go for the sweep in Game 4 vs. Grizzlies
content: Content extraction failed.

title: NBA playoff odds: Celtics still Eastern fave after Magic loss, Thunder leads West
content: the top-seeded Oklahoma City Thunder entered the playoffs as favorites to win the championship . they have a chance to close out the series tonight, where they are -1200 on the money line . the Los Angeles Lakers , Golden State Warriors , LA Clippers and Minnesota Timberwolves have better odds .

title: 6-team mock draft: How early did Paige Bueckers go?
content: the 2025 WNBA season is set to tip off on may 16, the ESPN experts came together for a fantasy women's basketball mock draft . we used the default settings -- a six-team league with nine players per team and the following scoring system . the participants of this mock draft were Charlie Creme, Eric Moody, Jason Shebilske, andre Snellings .

title: Follow live: With Sanders off the board at last, the picks keep coming at the NFL draft
content: S OG ESPN/ABC will air all three days of the 2025 draft live from Green Bay, Wisconsin . we're following every trade in the draft with full terms of the deals, all the way through Round 7's picks . check out some of the top highlights from Notre Dame's Riley Leonard .

title: Injured Rashford's season could be over - Emery
content: Marcus Rashford missed aston villa's 3-0 defeat to crystal palace . the forward picked up an injury that "could rule him out for the rest of the season" the news comes as a blow to Villa's hopes of a top-five finish in the premier league .

content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: The Resistance Front | New face of terror
content: The group, which emerged on the militancy landscape of Jammu and Kashmir in 2019, has a well-trained cadre that has carried out targeted killings in the Valley

title: Indus Waters Treaty | Storm beneath the waters
content: The 1960 agreement, which India has put in ‘abeyance’ after the Pahalgam terror attack, had started showing signs of decay in recent years with New Delhi demanding a bilateral modification of the treaty

title: Waqf amendment a political issue, not a Muslim issue, says Thangal
content: Waqf (Amendment) Act part of an anti-Muslim agenda aimed at curbing the religious freedom of the community and destroying the country’s pluralistic and secular policies, says resolution

title: Nainar Nagenthran | Man on a mission
content: The BJP’s new president in Tamil Nadu, an old AIADMK hand, seeks to build on the momentum his predecessor, Annamalai, created

title: NHAI starts work to raise height of retaining walls on bridges along Chennai-Bengaluru NH
content: Move comes after 71-year-old rider fell off the bridge near the Collectorate a week ago after he lost control of his vehicle upon hitting the bridge’s retaining wall. The total height of retaining walls will be increased to five feet, say officials

title: HC frowns upon top govt. officials for resisting steps taken by its retired judge to fill up Pachaiyappa’s college faculty vacancies
content: Justice Bharatha Chakravarthy says, he finds an orchestrated and concerted effort to overreach the orders passed by the first Division Bench of the High Court

title: T.N. government pays ₹1 lakh to lawyer subjected to custodial torture
content: It also instructs DGP to initiate disciplinary action against nine police personnel involved in human rights violations

title: BBMP polls likely to be delayed beyond October
content: If everything goes according to plan, the BBMP elections may be conducted before the end of 2025, says Transport and Muzrai Minister Ramalinga Reddy

title: West Bengal CM announces compensation for tourists killed in Pahalgam, fallen soldier in J&K
content: Thousands of people the join final journey of Army Havildar Jhantu Ali Sheikh who was killed in the line of duty in Udhampur in Jammu and Kashmir on April 24

title: Saving Sillahalla
content: The proposed Sillahalla Pumped Storage Hydroelectric Project has run into rough weather as local residents have come out to protest, fearing the impact of such a large-scale project on their lives and livelihood. Rohan Premkumar spends some time with them to find out what exactly bothers the villagers

title: Remote block along LoC in J&K connected by all-weather roads for the first time
content: Khwas has recorded zero incidents of terrorism in the past one year, says Rajouri Deputy Commissioner, citing the terrain and its remoteness as among the factors for high incidence of terrorism in the area

title: Former Kaleshwaram ENC B. Hari Ram arrested following raids at 14 locations linked to him
content: The arrest follows raids conducted at his residence and 13 other locations linked to him and his family that led to seizure of a catalogue of properties and luxury items

title: Supreme Court confirms CBI probe into the mysterious death of former Andhra MP’s close confidant
content: ‘Once an FIR is registered and investigation has taken place, direction for a CBI probe is not open to challenge’

title: Modi government’s tough stance on terrorism will shake Pakistan: Bandi Sanjay
content: This is a government that delivers on its promises, the Minister said pointing out that 10 lakh jobs were filled through ‘Rozgar Mela’

title: Tell him to get his mental condition checked: Union Minister Hardeep Puri slams Bilawal Bhutto Zardari’s comments on Indus
content: “Enough is enough... We will no longer tolerate this,” says Mr. Puri; responding to the Pakistani leader’s message to India that “either this water will flow from this Indus or your blood”

title: BJP MLA booked for hurting religious sentiments after high drama at Jaipur mosque
content: Balmukund Acharya, his supporters, and a large number of BJP leaders and workers allegedly raised offensive slogans at the Jama Masjid in the Walled City; the FIR said they threatened to kill Muslims

title: ‘Why has India’s feminist movement not spoken on Savitribai Phule as yet?’: Kancha Ilaiah
content: BJP, RSS have been trying to renegotiate with Phule, Ambedkar; BJP can’t afford to upset the OBCs, says Kancha Ilaiah Shepherd

title: Jignesh Mevani calls upon people to open ‘Samvidhan Shakhas’ to counter RSS
content: Samvidhana Samrakshakara Samavesha held in Davanagere resolves to have an army of one lakh people to defend the Indian constitution in three years

title: Thousands participated in mega job fair in Thrissur
content: Interviews conducted for around 35,000 job opportunities across 577 different sectors, offered by 151 employers

title: State comes up with final order to acquire land for Sabarimala airport
content: This is the second time that the State government is going through the land acquisition process as the previous notifications were revoked following objections

title: FIITJEE collected ₹206 crore as fees from students of current batches, but did not deliver on services, claims ED
content: It said that ₹181.89 crore was collected from 9,823 students for the academic year ending 2025-2026, but the centres in question were closed down

title: Karnataka urged to speed up work on water-swap treaty with Maharashtra for a long-term solution to water woes
content: Various organisations of Belagavi have written to Siddaramaiah and Ashok stating that a non-partisan bilateral agreement is in the interest of both States

title: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat alludes to the Ramayana in the aftermath of Pahalgam terror attack
content: ‘Our dharma is that we must not get beaten by tyrants and must teach a lesson to goons,’ the RSS chief said, adding, ‘The king’s job is to protect people and he must perform his duty.’

title: The high price of migration
content: Since 2024, up to 146 migrant labourers from Odisha have died under various circumstances in other States. While activists believe the death toll is much higher than the official statistics, Satyasundar Barik delves into the reasons for the premature deaths: negligence, ill-attention to the safety and health of workers, a mismatch between skills and job roles, and often, sheer overwork

title: Andhra Pradesh government will get 2.7% revenue share in the Kakinada Gateway Port, says Infrastructure and Investments Minister
content: Steps will be taken for  better road connectivity of ports and harbours with national highways, says B. C. Janardhan Reddy

title: Take strict action in substance abuse cases, Excise officials told
content: Licence of shops selling drugs should be cancelled, says Collector at District Development Committee meeting

title: Hyderabad paediatrician raises alarm over wrongly labelled ORS products
content: These products contain sugar levels comparable to packaged soft drinks and fruit juices, with only a slight increase in sodium content, which resulted in worsening of diarrhoea cases among children

title: Arrival of painted storks from Siberia brings joy to villagers of Veerapuram and Venkatapuram
content: Collector calls for intensified afforestation programmes around the two focal tank zones in Chilamathur mandal, besides grounding the desilting operations to allow water retention and construction of the basic amenities for visitors

title: As deadline to leave India nears, police intensify search to trace Pakistan citizens in Andhra Pradesh
content: We are searching every nook and corner to identify and send them back, and action will be taken against those staying illegally beyond the April 27 deadline, say police

title: Prakasam ranks first in A.P. livestock sector, 5th in milk production, says Collector
content: Veterinarians not only extend medical care to mute animals but also play a key role in the prevention of zoonotic diseases transmitted from livestock, says A. Thameem Ansaria

title: MGS wrote about Kozhikode and had an active life in the city
content: The late historian’s connection with Kozhikode started in 1947 when he joined the Zamorin’s Guruvayoorappan College as an intermediate student

title: Suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty: What are the implications for India and Pakistan?
content: The suspension of the 64-year-old Indus Waters Treaty raises critical questions for the two hostile neighbours. Does India possess the infrastructural capacity to divert waters and deprive Pakistan of its lifeline? Is unilateral suspension of the treaty permissible under international law?

title: Focus on infrastructure, tourism, and industry growth for prosperity, Lanka Dinakar tells officials of   Parvathipuram Manyam district
content: The Chairman of the Twenty-Point Programme Implementation Committee reviews the progress of the Centrally-sponsored schemes, projects and infrastructure development in the district

title: One killed, another critical in group clash near Thottiyam; two detained for questioning
content: A group of seven men, reportedly inebriated, assaulted three persons with knives before fleeing the spot at Kalluppatti near Thottiyam

title: SC seeks response from govt. on plea challenging bar on single, divorced men from becoming parents through surrogacy
content: The petitioner urged the court for a judicial declaration of his right to exercise his constitutionally protected right to reproductive autonomy

title: Two years on, SMILE scheme identifies fewer that 10,000 people engaged in begging; 970 rehabilitated
content: The Ministry has said that as of December 2024, 352 of those rehabilitated were children; 2011 Census counted over 3.7 lakh beggars in India

title: Agra police deny communal angle in restaurant worker’s murder
content: Authorities warn against spread of misinformation; say no evidence linking assailants to religious motive

title: Andhra Pradesh Excise Department fixes bar licence fee for 3-star and above hotels at ₹5 lakh per annum
content: A non-refundable registration charge of ₹20 lakh per annum will also be levied, according to a G.O.;  the order comes into force with effect from September 1, 2025

title: KMC meet passes several resolutions after heated exchanges between YSRCP, TDP member
content: YSRCP members express their resentment over non-implementation of resolutions passed by the general body earlier

title: President Murmu attends funeral Mass of Pope Francis
content: President Murmu reached Vatican City on Friday on a two-day visit to offer condolences on behalf of the Government and people of India
